title: What an assassin means
body: Take {{champion:91}}  for example.  He is the perfect example of an assassin because he is an all in kill one and is only able to get out through smart play/saving your ult.  Most assassins now, have too many escapes for their damage.  {{champion:245}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:7}} are just a few examples.  To me an assassin is someone who risks their life to get one target and, like I said with talon, can only get out or get extra kills through smart play.  A possible solution might be to decrease damage of those with more mobility, or to give mobility to those who don't have it (this would overall make assassins stronger and is therefore scary to toy with).

You sound like you're talking theory.
There's a difference between theory and experience.  If a Jax player has done it, then I accept their experience over any theory you can put forth.

3~4.

I am not talking theory, Jax and other bruisers are hurt a lot by poke and disengage.

Jax specifically doesn't have sustain early on and the fact that Zed's fighting is composed of disengage until Jax blows his E lets him win by afk farm even if he does not net a kill on Jax early on.

You are right, bruisers are hurt by poke and disengage.
Outside of LeBlanc and Fizz, most assassins don't have quick disengage.
Meanwhile, any bruiser worth his salt will either be dropping their own poke or going in for quick trades.
The power contained within a bruisers lvl 3 means an assassin is going to have to play safe until lvl 6.
Darius, Cho'Gath, Jax, Pantheon, Olaf, Renekton, these guys have means of either poking the enemy, or forcing trades.
Combine this with their massive power spikes and the fact that they can build tanky out of the gate and you have a situation where said assassin can't just roll over their enemy, they seriously have to outplay.

No, Jax doesn't have built in sustain, that's what a Doran's Blade can do.  And Jax jumping an enemy with a W/Q is pretty much a won trade.  Enemy wants the cannon minion, pop E and stand on top of it.

Zed's disengage isn't instant, he has to drop his shadow and jump to it, by then Jax has already landed his Q.
I'm not saying an assassin can't win that lane, but it's not going to be a sure win, this is why top lane was bruiser territory and assassins were rarely taken top, it was a struggle to really outdo a bruiser in lane due to how powerful their lvl 1-6 is.

I imagine if Jax is able to farm relatively well early on he would be able to both weather Zed's poke later in the game (due to a naturally tankier and higher sustain build) and catch out Zed unawares with a stun+leap combo, possibly baiting Zed's shadow dash beforehand.
It does not work that way, if Jax uses his E offensively he automatically loses the duel due to Zed's untargetability + deathmark.
